data: Summarize the information given.

The whitepaper outlines a project focused on optimizing and designing a new diffusion model that can be run in a typical home environment. The motivation is to address the computationally intensive nature of diffusion models by reducing training and inference costs. The project aims to modify an existing model to use fewer resources and operate more efficiently. Data for the project will be based on replicating a Reinforcement Learning (RL) model described in a specific article, with the goal of finding suitable datasets. The team intends to use the VizDoom engine and RL technology, aiming to replace an existing model with a diffusion model detailed in an academic paper. Relevant literature includes articles on diffusion models and the VizDoom platform. The project's success will be evaluated by measuring metrics such as framerate, CPU/GPU usage, and training time.

The whitepaper outlines a project focused on optimizing diffusion models to make them feasible for execution in typical domestic environments. The key issue addressed is the high computational demand of diffusion models, aiming to reduce training and inference costs. The project goals involve modifying an existing model to use fewer resources and run faster. The team plans to replicate a Reinforcement Learning (RL) model described in an article and find suitable data for a dataset. They will use the VizDoom engine and RL technology to implement a diffusion model based on the article: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2306.09305. They have identified relevant literature, including articles on diffusion models and VizDoom. The success of the project will be evaluated by measuring framerate, CPU/GPU utilization, and training time.

The whitepaper discusses a project focused on optimizing a diffusion model to make it feasible for use in a typical home environment. The problem addressed is the high computational demand of diffusion models, and the goal is to reduce training and inference costs. The project aims to modify an existing model to consume fewer resources and operate faster. It involves using VizDoom and Reinforcement Learning technologies to replace the current model with a diffusion model as described in the paper linked (https://arxiv.org/pdf/2306.09305). The team plans to replicate the model mentioned in an article to identify suitable data for their dataset. They will evaluate their work by measuring framerate, CPU/GPU usage, and training time, defining results as successful or unsuccessful based on these metrics. Key literature includes research on diffusion models as real-time game engines and resources on VizDoom.

The whitepaper discusses a project focused on optimizing a diffusion model to make it feasible to run in a typical home environment. The project is motivated by the high computational demands of diffusion models, with a goal to reduce training and inference costs. The project aims to modify an existing model to use fewer resources and run faster. Data for the project will be based on replicating an RL model described in a referenced article. The project will utilize the VizDoom engine and Reinforcement Learning technology, aiming to replace the current model with a diffusion model as detailed in a specific article. Relevant literature includes articles on diffusion models and the VizDoom platform. Evaluation metrics will include framerate, CPU/GPU usage, and training time.

The whitepaper discusses a project aimed at optimizing diffusion models to make them feasible for use in typical home environments. The primary goal is to reduce the computational costs associated with training and inference of these models. The project intends to modify an existing model to use fewer resources and operate more efficiently. Data for the project will be sourced by replicating the model described in a specific article, and the implementation will utilize the VizDoom engine and Reinforcement Learning technology. The team plans to replace the current model with a diffusion model outlined in a cited paper (https://arxiv.org/pdf/2306.09305). Key literature includes articles on diffusion models and VizDoom. Evaluation metrics will include framerate, CPU/GPU usage, and training time to define the success of the project.

Here is the translated content in Russian:

```
       Белая книга

Какую проблему вы собираетесь решить? Почему она интересна и актуальна?
Наш проект решает проблему оптимизации диффузионной модели и разработки новой модели, которую можно запускать в обычных домашних условиях. Это нас заинтересовало, потому что диффузионные модели очень требовательны к вычислительным ресурсам, и наша цель — найти способ снизить затраты на обучение и применение модели.

Каковы цели проекта?
Цель состоит в том, чтобы модифицировать модель, описанную в статье, так, чтобы она использовала меньше ресурсов и работала быстрее.

Какие данные вы будете использовать? Есть ли у вас существующие наборы данных или вы будете собирать данные самостоятельно?
В статье подробно описана модель RL. Мы намерены воспроизвести эту модель и на этой основе найти подходящие данные для набора данных.

Какой метод или алгоритм вы будете использовать? Вдохновлялись ли вы существующим решением, которое вы можете использовать? Как вы будете расширять и улучшать существующие решения?
Для реализации мы будем использовать движок VizDoom и технологию Reinforcement Learning. Наша цель — заменить существующую модель диффузионной моделью, которая описана в статье: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2306.09305.

Какую литературу вам необходимо изучить для ориентирования в решаемой проблеме? Если вы уже прочитали несколько статей, можете кратко их описать.
• DIFFUSION MODELS ARE REAL-TIME GAME ENGINES: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2408.14837
• Диффузионные модели: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2306.09305
• VizDoom: https://vizdoom.cs.put.edu.pl/

Как вы будете оценивать свои результаты (метрики, анализ и т.д.)? Как вы определяете "хорошие" и "неудачные" результаты?
Мы будем измерять частоту кадров, использование CPU/GPU и время обучения.
```

Subject: Proposal for Collaboration on Diffusion Model Optimization Project

Dear [Recipient's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. My name is [Your Name], and I am reaching out to introduce an exciting project that we believe aligns with the innovative work being done at [Startup Name].

Our team is currently engaged in a project focused on optimizing diffusion models and developing a new model that can efficiently operate in a standard home environment. The challenge lies in the computational demands of diffusion models, which we aim to address by reducing training and inference costs.

The primary goal of our project is to modify the existing model, as detailed in a recent publication, to use fewer resources while enhancing processing speed. We are utilizing the VizDoom engine in conjunction with Reinforcement Learning technology to achieve this. Our approach involves replacing the current model with a diffusion model described in the paper accessible here: [https://arxiv.org/pdf/2306.09305].

To support this endeavor, we plan to replicate the model described in the publication and subsequently identify suitable datasets for training. Our evaluation metrics include measuring framerate, CPU/GPU utilization, and training time to define successful outcomes.

We have been inspired by existing solutions and are eager to extend and improve upon them. Some of the literature informing our work includes:
- "DIFFUSION MODELS ARE REAL-TIME GAME ENGINES": [https://arxiv.org/pdf/2408.14837]
- VizDoom documentation: [https://vizdoom.cs.put.edu.pl/]

Given [Startup Name]'s expertise and innovative approach, we believe there is a significant opportunity for collaboration. We would be interested in exploring potential synergies and discussing how we can work together to advance this project further.

Please let me know if you are available for a meeting or a call to discuss this project in more detail. I am looking forward to the possibility of collaborating and achieving groundbreaking results together.

Thank you for considering this opportunity. I look forward to your response.

Warm regards,

[Your Full Name]  
[Your Position]  
[Your Contact Information]  
[Your Company/Organization Name]

2. **Project Goals**: The primary goal is to modify an existing model to use fewer resources and to run faster.

3. **Data Usage**: The project plans to replicate an existing RL model from a paper to identify suitable data for a dataset.

4. **Methodology/Algorithm**: The project will use the VizDoom engine and Reinforcement Learning technology. The intention is to replace the existing model with a diffusion model described in a specific paper (https://arxiv.org/pdf/2306.09305).

5. **Literature for Study**: 
   - "DIFFUSION MODELS ARE REAL-TIME GAME ENGINES": https://arxiv.org/pdf/2408.14837

6. **Evaluation Metrics**: The results will be evaluated based on framerate, CPU/GPU usage, and training time. "Good" results are defined by improvements in these metrics, while "unsuccessful" results would show no improvements or deterioration in these areas.
